items.label: LC047-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to ask a question about feedback or a grade I received

items.label: LC027-C
items.sakai-capability: I want anyone in the class to be able to ask questions at (almost) any time

items.label: LC027-D
items.sakai-capability: I don't want to have to answer the same question over and over again

items.label: LC027-E
items.sakai-capability:
with attribution or confidentially (with identity hidden from some) or anonymously (with identity hidden from all)

with support for private replies, targeted replies (to some but not all), public replies (available to all in the space)

items.label: LC093-F
items.sakai-capability: Student users should be able to share with different audiences including each other, instructors, institutions.departments, specific individuals (prospective employers or relatives), and the public at large. Each audience will likely require a different view of the same collection of items.

items.label: LC093-E
items.sakai-capability: Users should be able to assemble, display, and share any item they have created or own. Students should be able to share collections or associations of their learning artifacts and reflections with any other user in the application, with any email address, or as a public URL. Students should also be able to submit learning artifacts to other users for formative feedback or summative evaluation.

items.label: LC093-C
items.sakai-capability: Share any combination of learning artifacts and reflections with others.

items.label: LC155-D
items.sakai-capability: Set permissions for different features or tools when giving access to a new TA.

items.label: LC019-E
items.sakai-capability: Feedback . comment with rich-text formatting and attachments for any object

items.label: LC155-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to be able to give access to teaching assistants in a way that makes sense to me.

items.label: LC019-D
items.sakai-capability: I want to provide feedback on submitted work; I want students to review and critique each other's work as well.

items.label: LC145-F
items.sakai-capability: Permissions control within a site - only certain users given permission to collaborate (group work)

items.label: LC019-G
items.sakai-capability: Grades are a special case of feedback and non-numerical assessment should be supported; Instructor feedback; self feedback; peer feedback; external to class review; external to system review; multitude of permissions for who can see what.  Another form of feedback is an interactive rubric in which the instuctor or reviewer simply checks the relevant score.description for each category.  The total score can then be optionally fed to the gradebook (IU has this working in Sakai via an integration with iRubric).

items.label: LC155-E
items.sakai-capability: Create a TA profile and apply it to my new TAs.

items.label: LC019-F
items.sakai-capability: Any object can receive a comment or grade; Grouping of objects (e.g., portfolio) that receive feedback; both open and structured feedback (Notifications of results and feedback sent directly to student email, accessed in Sakai - CSU)

items.label: LC145-D
items.sakai-capability: Collaborate without needing to use wiki markup lge

items.label: LC091-F
items.sakai-capability: Presentations of collections of student items should include the potential for a different view for each audience. These views should be supplied by administrators or be easily constructed by students.

items.label: LC145-E
items.sakai-capability: Googledocs functionality

items.label: LC091-G
items.sakai-capability: Presentation functionality should be built into the application without the need for additional customization.

items.label: LC148-D
items.sakai-capability: Planning tool, perhaps as part of portfolio

items.label: LC148-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to plan my course, subjects, study goals and career goals

items.label: LC145-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to collaboratively create content in an easy way

items.label: LC091-E
items.sakai-capability: Students should have an intuitive and multi-faceted interface to use in designing and creating an aesthetically pleasing as well as meaningful display of any items they have available to them. Students should be able to convert any workflow in which they participate into a sharable portfolio presentation.

items.label: LC149-D
items.sakai-capability: Embed animations, images into subject content

items.label: LC091-C
items.sakai-capability: Easily assemble and creatively display collections or associations of items and reflections one owns or has created.

items.label: LC149-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to easily embed content from the web

items.label: LX105-C
items.sakai-capability: I’d like to continue conversations with students in the course after the course has been completed.

items.label: LX105-E
items.sakai-capability: A communication tool (discussion forum, blogger, or wiki) that has a life beyond the course semester. Perhaps each student has a personal blogger which can be accessed by the students and instructor in each of their courses.

items.label: LC019-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to give my students grades

items.label: LC016-E
items.sakai-capability: Simple submission.grade workflow; Submission by group; make and post homework forms for my students to complete and I want the results compiled into one file.

items.label: LC016-F
items.sakai-capability: Peer review, team projects where individual effort is assessed along with group product, double blind reviews

items.label: LC016-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to assign my students some homework

items.label: LC016-D
items.sakai-capability: I want students to propose their own projects

items.label: LC015-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to have a class discussion about a particular topic

items.label: LC012-G
items.sakai-capability: Content may be in a site or another site; may be in the system or out of the system

items.label: LC012-F
items.sakai-capability: Materials are searchable, taggable, supporting annotations (Students able to tag content with 'like' as feedback to academic and other students - CSU)

items.label: LC015-F
items.sakai-capability: Ability to move individual posts or entire discussion threads to a new or different discussion. Ability to privately respond to a post. Ability to grade.rate a post. Ability to see all posts by an individual across multiple discussion topics. Ability to search for keywords to pull up related posts. Ability to have students see the contributions of others -after- they make their own contribution. (Ability to tag posts to particular topics that have been set up by instructor e.g. help, tech issues, tutorial qns - then create a FAQ list from tagged items - CSU)

items.label: LC012-E
items.sakai-capability: File Sharing. Content Creation

items.label: LC015-G
items.sakai-capability: Google Wave-like capability of discussion, messaging, instant messaging, etc.

items.label: LC015-D
items.sakai-capability: I want students to lead a discussion on a particular topic.

items.label: LC012-D
items.sakai-capability: Students need to be able to comment on and critique content (CSU)

items.label: LC016-G
items.sakai-capability: Flexible custom assessment workflows

items.label: LC015-E
items.sakai-capability: Threaded discussion

items.label: LC012-C
items.sakai-capability: I need to share with my students my lecture notes

items.label: LC017-E
items.sakai-capability: Full range of questions types; question pools; randomized selection and presentation of items; randomized ordering of choices for mc type questions.

items.label: LC017-D
items.sakai-capability: I want students to demonstrate what they have learned.

items.label: LC018-G
items.sakai-capability: Measure success of content through summary of how students did on embedded activities

items.label: LC017-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to assess my students' knowledge

items.label: LC018-F
items.sakai-capability: Completion or scored result stored centrally with other grades. (Multiple question types, including open-ended, likert etc - CSU)

items.label: LC018-E
items.sakai-capability: Embed a question, poll or scored activity within a content page.

items.label: LC018-D
items.sakai-capability: I want to engage students as they work through content

items.label: LC141-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to know about recent activity.changes in the groups of which I'm a member

items.label: LC018-C
items.sakai-capability: I want my students to be thinking and doing, not just listening to me talk or reading what I write.

items.label: LC141-D
items.sakai-capability: Recent content flagged - like live feed in Facebook

items.label: LC017-F
items.sakai-capability: calculated question types with support for variables; autogeneration of charts and graphs based on question data; share assessments with other instructors.courses.students. Item statistics.

items.label: LC081-E
items.sakai-capability: Students should be encouraged to reflect anywhere. Any item should allow a reflection to be associated with it.

items.label: LC081-F
items.sakai-capability: Reflection can be freeform or structured. It may also be a form of self-evaluation, offering the ability to see one's own growth over time.

items.label: LC081-C
items.sakai-capability: Reflect upon learning or accomplishments.

items.label: LC081-G
items.sakai-capability: Rubrics may be associated with reflective processes.

items.label: LC068-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to see all of my assignments for all of my current semester classes in one place and I want to see which assignment(s) are due next.

items.label: LC068-E
items.sakai-capability: Central location for all assessment information, across cohorts (CSU)

items.label: LC068-D
items.sakai-capability: Collation of all assignment information (CSU)

items.label: LC068-F
items.sakai-capability:
Ability to export and import grade formats in Excel
(CSU)

items.label: LC083-C
items.sakai-capability: Tag any item with metadata, goals, or other information of one's own creation or from a shared location.

items.label: LC067-C
items.sakai-capability: I want the freedom to make as many changes to my work as I choose until the due date has passed.  Once the due date has passed, I want my work to be automatically submitted to my instructor.  I don't want to have to remember to submit it myself.

items.label: LC083-G
items.sakai-capability: Many schools of education and K-12 school districts need to house lists containing thousands of goals to use in tagging learning artifacts.

items.label: LC083-F
items.sakai-capability: Institutions and instructors should be able to define and push tags to students and student artifacts. Students should be able to view tags others have associated with their learning artifacts.

items.label: LC083-E
items.sakai-capability: Any item a user creates should be tagable. All items should be tagged with date.time stamps. Tags should be applicable at the text, document, and item levels.

items.label: LC099-E
items.sakai-capability: Option to download only the submitted files with filenames including.appending the participant's username.

items.label: LC099-G
items.sakai-capability: Faculty act as advisors and have a large number of in-flux students to track and maintain.  Many of them have students complete MS Word or PDF forms and submit them weekly.  Per 2.5.4, accessing submitted assignments requires several extra clicks up and down directories per person; many faculty want to just be able to immediately access the submissions and.or glance over who has submitted files.

items.label: LC099-F
items.sakai-capability: The option to download a gradesheet with the files submitted.  Option for no folders or sub-folders.  Option to choose to auto-grade (checkmark) for the action of the students submitting any file.  Ability to provide comments on same gradesheet.

items.label: LC087-C
items.sakai-capability: Push grades or relevant ratings from portfolio workflows into the grading system.

items.label: LC087-E
items.sakai-capability: Administrators and instructors should be able to push relevant grades and.or ratings from portfolio workflows directly into the grading system.

items.label: LC085-C
items.sakai-capability: Provide formative feedback in relation to any item or workflow to which one has access.

items.label: LC085-F
items.sakai-capability: Rubrics should be available for use in providing feedback.

items.label: LC085-E
items.sakai-capability: Instructors with permission should be able to provide students with formative feedback on any workflow at any time. Students with permission should be able to provide formative feedback on the work of other students. Feedback processes should allow flexible workflows and roles.

items.label: LC099-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to be able to access or download all student assignments (submission) as simply and quickly as possible without barriers (i.e., folders).

items.label: LC048-C
items.sakai-capability: I need course evaluation data from students

items.label: LC048-F
items.sakai-capability: Evaluation results can easily be reviewed within a single course, across colleges or departments, or across the entire university. Results can be reviewed for a single evaluation covering a short time period, or can be displayed for a series of evaluations conducted across a larger time period.

items.label: LC048-E
items.sakai-capability: Provide end-of-semester survey to students; reminders sent to students to complete; data is anonymous; data is not available to instructor until final grades have been submitted.  Survey is a combination of campus level prescribed items, school.department level prescribed, and instructor level optional questions.

items.label: LC048-D
items.sakai-capability: An evaluation is designed specifically for conducting formative and summative (end of term) evaluations of your course sites. However, it can also be used for more general surveys. An evaluation consists of a series of scaled (i.e. rating) questions, multiple choice with single answer questions, multiple choice with multiple answer questions, and.or free text questions, which are delivered to site members over a fixed time period (typically a few days).

items.label: LC092-E
items.sakai-capability: Rich text editors should be built into workflows to allow students to creatively display and share information about themselves. Students should have multiple options representing different levels of technological expertise to creatively display their work.

items.label: LC144-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to socialise with others in a way I can choose

items.label: LC092-C
items.sakai-capability: Creatively display information about oneself.

items.label: LC144-D
items.sakai-capability: Ability to communicate across subjects, within a course, outside a course

items.sakai-capability: Wordwrapping of titles within tools

items.sakai-capability: I want my 'labels' to look professional

items.sakai-capability: Insert images directly into blogs

items.label: LC134-E
items.sakai-capability: Need to incorporate from other files into text editor without losing formatting, equations, diagrams,

items.label: LC134-D
items.sakai-capability: Content creation and importing

items.label: LC134-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to easily incorporate other files into Sakai

items.label: LC135-D
items.sakai-capability: Site management

items.label: LC135-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to choose the tools I want, and have the flexibility to turn them off and save data later on

items.label: LC046-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to know where there were questions about an assignment, and keep that as a record so that I can improve it for next time

items.label: LC135-E
items.sakai-capability: Choice to save data once tool is turned off.

items.label: LC142-E
items.sakai-capability: improved equation editor, object embedding with an external equation editor like MathType  [CSU-WW]. Support for phonetic fonts [CSU-TH], content printable by default [CSU-WW]

items.label: LC006-F
items.sakai-capability: Special class of messages and notifications. (Text editor needs to allow for high levels of formatting - look professional - CSU)

items.label: LC142-F
items.sakai-capability: Add' button to enable quick addition of content and functions (in place of web content tool?) [CSU-BTH]

items.label: LC006-G
items.sakai-capability: Mailtool-like capability to message to groups within course (e.g. sections) or hand picked lists from roster; also, email-archive-like capability for site groups

items.label: LC007-C
items.sakai-capability: I need to take attendance

items.label: LC007-D
items.sakai-capability: I need to see who has visited the online course space; Track . document physical presence; We need to track activity and engagement

items.label: LC140-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to let my friends know when I'm online, but not necessarily let everyone know

items.label: LC140-D
items.sakai-capability: More control over the presence tool

items.label: LC140-E
items.sakai-capability: Set visibility for different groups (e.g. friends), quickly and easily manage changes in visibility

items.label: LC140-F
items.sakai-capability: Users don't appear as online if are idle for more than (say) 10 mins.

items.label: LC013-D
items.sakai-capability: I want to see lecture notes from other classmates

items.label: LC013-E
items.sakai-capability: File Sharing. Content Creation

items.sakai-capability: I want to share my personal notes on the lecture with a classmate

items.label: LC007-E
items.sakai-capability:
Recording and reporting of event data (incl.chat sessions, even if users have deleted posts - CSU)
; In addition to attendance, track class participation "

items.label: LC011-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to organize my course materials and activities in a way that reflects the organizational structure of my course

items.label: LC006-C
items.sakai-capability: I need to welcome my students to class

items.label: LC007-F
items.sakai-capability: Integrated with card swipe or other automatic roll call; Tracks occurrences as well as time on task. Instructor able to define which events need tracking; Reporting by individual and class, daily and weekly summaries

items.label: LC007-G
items.sakai-capability: Student pictures arranged in seating chart, ability to mark.unmark those present; display results of recent poll, quiz, assignment submission, etc. for each person in support of just-in-time teaching strategies.

items.label: LC006-E
items.sakai-capability: Messaging one to many

items.label: LC011-G
items.sakai-capability: Include embedded content and activities from anywhere in the system and link to external sources (Linkages between tools, so that if I update a reading list, it updates the references to that in the content - CSU)

items.label: LC011-F
items.sakai-capability: Conditional Release (conditional flow) (seamless with other applications - ppt, LaTex - easily block releasee content e.g.every Friday and set this up once only - CSU)

items.label: LC011-E
items.sakai-capability: Content Creation and Sequencing (Embedded functions so that students aren't moving from one tool to another - link to.embed forum posts, polls  or quizzes in other tools etc. - CSU)

items.label: LC011-D
items.sakai-capability: I need to present to my students some course material they can work through on their own

items.label: LC142-D
items.sakai-capability: Easy content building for all disciplines

items.label: LC142-C
items.sakai-capability: I want more flexibility when adding online content

items.label: LC076-C
items.sakai-capability: Export and import educational workflows.

items.label: LC082-F
items.sakai-capability: Students should be able to take content from one context and use it outside of Sakai in other Web2.0 apps. (CSU)

items.label: LC078-E
items.sakai-capability: Portfolio workflows offer opportunities for student growth by helping them understand what they have learned and how they have learned it. Portfolios also alert students to the need to manage the way their personal information is dispalyed and shared on line.

items.label: LC082-E
items.sakai-capability: At any time, users may take previous work and assign it new meaning in new contexts.

items.label: LC078-F
items.sakai-capability: Users can move beyond the preordained structure of a portfolio implementation to organize their own work and use it for their own purposes.

items.label: LC078-C
items.sakai-capability: Empower students to understand their learning and take control of their virtual identity.

items.label: LC082-C
items.sakai-capability: Access previous work for application to new contexts.

items.label: LC079-E
items.sakai-capability: Any learning artifact students create and any multimedia file they upload should be available in their collection for reflection, tagging, association, sharing, evaluation, and reporting.

items.label: LC079-C
items.sakai-capability: Collect and organize learning artifacts and other multimedia items.

items.label: LC077-C
items.sakai-capability: Guide educational workflows.

items.label: LC079-F
items.sakai-capability: Students should also be able to collect material outside of the application including standardized test scores, URLs, and personal information contained in other databases.

items.label: LC077-F
items.sakai-capability: Guidance should be closely associated with the workflow and provide an overt way for students to easily understand what is expected of them.

items.label: LC077-E
items.sakai-capability: Instructors should be able to provide instructions, rationale, and.or examples for students completing educational workflows.

items.label: LC076-E
items.sakai-capability: Once created, workflows representing portfolio processes can be easily exported for reuse in another context within the same instance or across instances of the application.

items.label: LC116-E
items.sakai-capability: Autograded problem sets that provide immediate feedback and automatically (or manually) adapts to student needs--giving more opportunities to  practice and improve in areas of weakness.

items.label: LC116-C
items.sakai-capability: I want immediate feedback on and opportunities to practice course-related knowledge and skills

items.label: LC115-E
items.sakai-capability: a student submits a piece of examinable work.  The submission is logged.  The submission has user id.email. stripped and (possibly) replaced by their candidate number.  The examiner downloads a collection of examinable, anonymised submissions, and then marks them.

items.label: LC115-F
items.sakai-capability: The examiner uploads the marked work, and then the system married the exam candidate number with the individual student who submitted, so that marks can be fed back to the student

items.label: LC115-C
items.sakai-capability: I want the students I'm examining to be able to submit their papers.dissertations electronically, for their submission to be verifiable by my administrator, and for me to be able to download anonymised files

items.label: LC115-D
items.sakai-capability: I want to download anonymised exam submissions

items.label: LC086-G
items.sakai-capability: Users with permission should be able to share rubrics. Functionality for evaluation should be flexible enough to support multiple models of evaluation, single or multiple, double blind, and.or peer evaluation.

items.label: LC086-F
items.sakai-capability: Instructors should have the option to create rubrics and apply them to almost anything. Rubrics should be linked to learning outcomes and.or facilitate additional ways to present expectations for learning. Rubrics should allow evaluators to rate by clicking the descriptor for each rating and should also tablulate the overall score.

items.label: LC086-C
items.sakai-capability: With permission use a rubric to provide summative evaluation for any item or workflow.

items.label: LC086-E
items.sakai-capability: Instructors with permission should be able to summatively evaluate any learning artifact or workflow using a rubric. Evaluation processes should allow flexible workflows and roles.

items.label: LC113-E
items.sakai-capability: Future integration of automatic speech to text to support people with hearing impairments.

items.label: LC113-C
items.sakai-capability: I want the option to record audio or video along with written feedback to students on work they submit. I do not want to have to use multiple applications in order to do this.

items.label: LC114-C
items.sakai-capability: I want my student to give feedback and.or formally review.grade.evaluate each other's work (peer review)

items.label: LC040-E
items.sakai-capability: Set up and view content in a single site, and have that content automatically and instantaneously propagated to all sites in a group of my choosing. The sites are not merged: Instructors still have full autonomy in their teaching in their individual sites.

items.label: LC040-G
items.sakai-capability: From the coordinator site, have extremely granular control over opening.locking of tools; e.g. set up the gradebook, and allow.not allow individual instructors to add items; e.g. view all students in a group of sites and view, override, manipulate grades; e.g. perform statistical analysis of grade data across all sites (or a subset of sites), according to demographic data; generate charts and reports on grade data.    Also consider similar for responses to surveys; Also look for trending words.expressions across student discussion in chat rooms, forums, but also assignments.

items.label: LC114-E
items.sakai-capability: Assign peer review teams, groups, features that allow students to provide comments, apply a rubric, or perhaps even grade another student's work

items.label: LC040-C
items.sakai-capability: I need to be able to coordinate a large course with many instructors and sub-sections, and a very large number of students.

items.label: LC074-E
items.sakai-capability: Students should control access to their items, determine who is invited to view them, and decide when to submit a workflow for evaluation. No one other than the system administrator should be able to access the student's private workspace. (All interactions should be logged in case of altercations - CSU)

items.label: LC074-F
items.sakai-capability: Users have the right to privacy and the right to own their work globally and by artifact. (Students should be able to arrange.personalise their site to reflect what's important to them as learners. Graphics-based interface rather than text-based. Should be able to seamlessly pull in parts of PLE from both within and outside uni e.g. library databases that they use - CSU)

items.label: LC074-C
items.sakai-capability: Have a private workspace.

items.label: LC143-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to create a site for students from multiple cohorts

items.label: LC153-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to be able to easily locate a file.page.message.etc that I've seen before in this workspace.

items.label: LC031-G
items.sakai-capability: One instructor is in charge of all the Spanish 1 classes but there are several other instructors.  She would like to set up a course site where they can all share materials but also post their own individual materials that only their section would see.

items.label: LC045-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to ask a question about a task I don't understand, and see the answers to questions other people had about the task as well

items.label: LC075-E
items.sakai-capability: Instructors should be able to create workflows that guide students in processes of learning, reflection, evaluation, assessment, and personal representation. Workflows should be closely coordinated with guidance and be as intuitive as possible for students.

items.label: LC075-C
items.sakai-capability: Create educational workflows.

items.label: LC073-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to be able to link to specific assignments, Forum topics, Wiki pages, blog posts, tests, surveys

items.label: LC075-G
items.sakai-capability: A workflow engine should assist instructors in creating workflows.Students should be able to enter workflows at various points; in specific, transfer students should be able to enter at the appropriate place.

items.label: LC075-F
items.sakai-capability: Workflows should be easy to create and edit and not involve additional coding. Complex workflows should not cause performance problems for the system. (Students should receive an email notification when they complete particular tasks within the workflow - CSU)

items.label: LC030-D
items.sakai-capability: Let the course space unfold naturally throughout the semester (includes letting the old fall away).

items.label: LC030-C
items.sakai-capability: I want students to be able to focus on what we're doing now.

items.label: LC030-F
items.sakai-capability: Allow me to easily say when I don't want material to be viewable by others -- at any time or when I'm originally posting material.

items.label: LC073-E
items.sakai-capability: deep linking throughout

items.label: LC030-E
items.sakai-capability: Automatically hide time sensitive material that is no longer relevant, like announcement that are older than 3 weeks.

items.label: LC073-D
items.sakai-capability: Make it simple for students to get to the items that need their attention without having to give a paragraph of instructions.

items.label: LC031-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to coordinate with other instructors teaching the same class

items.label: LC153-E
items.sakai-capability: Full-text searching across all tools.features, with advanced searching by author, create.last modified date, etc.

items.label: LC072-E
items.sakai-capability: http:..confluence.sakaiproject.org.display.UX.Portfolio-related+vignettes

items.label: LC143-E
items.sakai-capability: Easily create new site drawing in cohorts from other sites

items.label: LC072-D
items.sakai-capability: See Portfolio vignettes:

items.label: LC143-D
items.sakai-capability: Create a course (program) site that lasts for the duration of the degree (until archival)

items.label: LC072-C
items.sakai-capability: Support for wide range of portfolio related activities: Guide, Collect, Reflect, Tag, Associate, Evaluate, Share, Report, Flow, Assess, Present, Customize, Preserve, Document, Collaborate, Own, Empower, Re-purpose, Port, Express, Migrate

items.label: LC164-C
items.sakai-capability: Simple way to link in notes, dates, assignments in one place for students to know what went on in a particular day

items.label: LC124-D
items.sakai-capability: Group sub-sites

items.label: LC124-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to set up breakout rooms that operate for short periods

items.label: LC124-F
items.sakai-capability: Group composition would need to change per task. Randomised allocation to groups. Assessment tools need to be part of the breakout rooms. Need tracking of groups and ability to provide feedback. Abilty to share work . communication from one group to other groups.

items.label: LC124-E
items.sakai-capability: Set up individual breakout rooms where small groups of students can work on a particular task for 2 weeks, then move onto the next one (conditional release into new room).

items.label: LC123-F
items.sakai-capability: Instructor receives automatic feed about student activity - what is accessed, how many times, how long spent there [BTH]. Overview shown in table with student list on left, then columns for not started, partially complete, complete for each resource [WW]

items.label: LC121-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to send feedback notifications via email when commenting on assessment tasks in the wiki.blog

items.label: LC157-C
items.sakai-capability: I need to easily move course structure and content from one course to another, one semester to another.

items.label: LC039-D
items.sakai-capability: I wish there were a lot of common things my instructors all did the same.

items.label: LC123-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to track my students participation and engagement with the course

items.label: LC163-C
items.sakai-capability: I want a one-stop-shop for coordinating groups, group behavior, group work

items.label: LC039-E
items.sakai-capability: School or department can set default capabilities, structure, and placement.navigation.

items.label: LC123-E
items.sakai-capability: Abilty to see who has read different pieces of communication, with embedded email so can immediately chase those who haven't seen critical items. [OA] Track where student has progressed to in Modules [WW] Track if students haven't logged on or completed a task {BTH]

items.label: LC163-E
items.sakai-capability: On one form or functionality, i want to be able to create groups; populate them (either manually or automatically with criteria that I set); set permissions; and set a profile of interaction types (forum, assignment, wiki, etc).

items.label: LC039-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to not have to learn a new way of doing things for each course

LC121-D
items.sakai-capability: Ability to email from within all tools

items.label: LC070-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to continue to have access to all of my work products after the class and even after I graduate.

items.label: LC121-E
items.sakai-capability: Email 'quicklink' within other tools, opening to a list of participants that allows quick email within the tool itself

items.label: LC049-E
items.sakai-capability: Have a calendar format as a representation of the organization of a learning space and make this the default view for anyone entering the learning space.

items.label: LC071-C
items.sakai-capability: Provide a memory of activities undertaken in a given class

items.sakai-capability: I want to stage the release of new tasks, conditional on completion of other tasks

items.sakai-capability: Staged, conditional  release of assessment items

items.label: LC049-C
items.sakai-capability: All of my colleagues and I in our shared program want to start each class by referring to a common display of this week's topics and due dates.

items.sakai-capability: Inform students about university, department and my policies. [copied into alternative goal of "My students need to have the course syllabus"]

items.label: LC059-C
items.sakai-capability: I want my students to do some peer teaching.

items.label: LC071-E
items.sakai-capability: time, versioning capability

items.label: LC122-E
items.sakai-capability: Once one part of the assessment is complete, the next task automatically becomes available, with instructions included. The task does not have to be graded to release the next part.

items.label: LC010-C
items.sakai-capability:
I need to set expectations about course policies 

[copied into alternative goal of "My students need to have the course syllabus"]

items.label: LC071-D
items.sakai-capability: annotate the memory documents

items.label: LC164-E
items.sakai-capability: A way to go to a tool where you can describe the days lecture, attach lecture slides, link to an assignment or quiz and post it on the schedule.calendar.  This way the students can see the "event" on the calendar, click the event and get to all the content for the day.

items.label: LC071-F
items.sakai-capability: time frame playing (as in google wave)

items.label: LC051-F
items.sakai-capability: I would then have the option of including student generated content in the new iteration of the course.  When I go to do a course import I would be given the option of selecting which student generated content should be imported into the new site.

items.label: LC051-G
items.sakai-capability: Each week of my course I would post my lecture notes along with some supplement course content e.g. (my thoughts on current events).  During the week as students worked through the materials and participated in online discussions I would encourage them to contribute to my original course content by adding their thoughts, feedback, links to good resources, videos they thought provide new perspectives, etc.  Initially these student contributions would only be viewable by myself but I would get e-mail alerts that students had contributed.  I could then go in and either approve the content to be viewable by others, be able to edit the content or delete it.  It would also be useful if some level of IP control was available for students such as creative commons attributes so that they could indicate how content they added could be used.  Then when I was getting ready for the next semester I could decide what student content I wanted imported for next year.

items.label: LC103-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to tag discussion forums.

items.label: LC051-E
items.sakai-capability: Students would be able to leave some type of "sticky note" on my course lecture notes or other course content as means to enhance the course materials (or point out mistakes).

items.label: LC041-D
items.sakai-capability: Goals and rubrics can be a way for an institution to differentiate itself through standards for excellence from other institutions and for showing that program X complies with Association Y's expectations.

items.label: LC103-E
items.sakai-capability: Tag can be private or shared. If private, tag is in the form of a flag to easily allow someone to find a forum that they’d like to return to. If shared, tag is in the form of a “thumbs up” to indicate that a forum is useful or helpful. The name of the person who flagged a forum with a “thumbs up” tag is associated with the tag.

items.label: LC051-C
items.sakai-capability: I want my students to be able to add content, thoughts, and ideas to my original course content.

items.label: LC041-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to represent specific campus.school.program learning goals (and associated grading.assessment rubrics) as a framework for a large set of courses.

items.label: LC041-F
items.sakai-capability:
Goals created by others (the individual student or instructor or a particular program) can be mapped to larger campus.school goals.

Some rubrics may be general purpose rubrics that are NOT tied to an assessment, but the dissemination of these approved rubrics may be a
strategy of an institution to push forward an agenda of best practice for assessment by providing a handy reference library of general purpose writing, mathematics and science rubrics (for example). While the choice whether or not to use one of these "off the shelf" rubrics (and which one) is left to the teacher, providing some information to the teacher about the schools expectations of its students at different stages (and perhaps suggesting an appropriate rubric for this grade level.stage of development) would make this service more valuable.

items.label: LC041-E
items.sakai-capability: Some goals and rubrics are rather specific must be approved by an "assessment coordinator" for educational QA purposes as part of a larger assessment system strategy. Changing the assessment.rubric in this case involves more than just an individual instructor.

items.label: LC102-E
items.sakai-capability: I want a tool that lets me create and coordinate simple online games whose rules and parameters I can set. I want to be able to create and manage alternate reality games

items.label: LC102-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to create simple online games and alternate reality games

items.label: LC069-E
items.sakai-capability: Generate content that is compliant with industry standards. Easily import.export (CSU)

items.label: LC069-F
items.sakai-capability: IMS SCORM compliant content authoring (CSU)

items.label: LC069-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to easily be able to take all of my teaching materials with me when I go to another institution using Sakai.

items.label: LC041-G
items.sakai-capability:
Some items in the library of "off the shelf" goals and rubrics are merely starting points. There is not a priority to ensure that everyone is doing assessment the exact same way. When a teacher uses one of these rubrics, they can easily edit the performance indicators to suit their needs and create a new rubric, just for their new assignment.

Goals and rubrics can be shared with others. This is a bottom up approach to establishing "best practice". As the
teachers create their own rubrics against goals, they have the opportunity to publish them as part of the "reusable" library so other teachers can use.edit.republish them.

items.label: LC065-F
items.sakai-capability: Some type of review process by which instructional activities could be peer reviewed and "rated" so other instructors could get some external validation that the instructional strategies were sound.

items.label: LC065-E
items.sakai-capability: As I am building a course I could annotate and tag content and learning activities with information as to the pedagogy or instructional strategy that I'm using and how I applied it.

items.label: LC065-G
items.sakai-capability: Surfacing these instructional strategies as instructors are building courses.  For example, I might be designing an online discussion activity around case studies.  I could do a search to see if others, both at my institutions as well as others, have created case-study based discussions and then get to see brief information and comments on how they approached it.

items.label: LC066-E
items.sakai-capability: Edit window turns into canvas with minimal line tools, controlled by mouse.

items.label: LC066-D
items.sakai-capability: Pictorial, mapping, and diagramming responses, with or without a preliminary graphic provided.

items.label: LC066-G
items.sakai-capability: Student sees map sketch; questions include (1) marking specific location, (2) circumscribing area, (3) showing direction of development, migration, etc.

items.label: LC066-C
items.sakai-capability: I want my students to submit simple drawings and diagrams on exam answers.

items.label: LC065-C
items.sakai-capability: I would like to easily share instructional strategies with other instructors

items.label: LC065-D
items.sakai-capability: I would like to share instructional strategies with colleagues at my institution as well as other institutions.

items.sakai-capability: Summary and statistics for individual assignments and the entire gradebook that can be viewed by anyone

items.label: LC152-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to know how I am doing compared to my peers (on specific assignments and as a whole)

items.sakai-capability: Functionality similar to Google sidewiki or Diigo

items.sakai-capability: Allow comments and other annotations of media objects including tagging, grading, etc. Be able to export.print annotations; also import annotations like transcripts, closed captioning, etc. Integrate the media tool with Sakai (and other) services.

items.label: LC050-E
items.sakai-capability: Have a unified tool for working with media objects, across format: e.g. Upload a video and have it automatically recognized, reformatted as necessary, and presented in a native default.customizable player; e.g. upload a sound file and have it behave the same way as above; link to a web-hosted video or audio file and present the content in the native player.

items.sakai-capability: I want to be notified when I receive a grade ofeedback from my instructor

items.label: LC084-E
items.sakai-capability: Any item created by or owned by a student should be associable with any other item or with any educational workflow. Associations of items should be available for sharing. Instructors should be able to prepopulate workflows by associating items students are assigned to create.

items.label: LC084-F
items.sakai-capability: Collections of items should be easy to combine. Collections should be able to be downloaded.

items.label: LC084-G
items.sakai-capability: Administrators should be able to connect.associate items across users.

items.label: LC084-C
items.sakai-capability: Associate any item in one's collection with any other item to which one has access.

items.label: LC052-E
items.sakai-capability: Tool for generating analytic and holstic rubrics.  Instructor enters criteria, rating scale, and characterisics of work associated with each point on the scale.  Rubric can be attached to any example of student work and isntructor can opt to display to students before submission.  To grade or evaluate, instructor clicks or selects the rating for each criterion.  Students see a read only version of the rubric with the instructions rating selections.

items.label: LC052-F
items.sakai-capability:
Instructors can easily classify and share rubrics with specific colleagues, their department, program, campus , and.or the public.  Rubrics can be associated with learning outcomes.goals.

Instructor can give rubric to students to assess their own work or the work of their peers.

items.label: LC052-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to create an analytic rubric or holistic, share it with my students,  and use it to grade and.or evaluate an open-ended assignment or artifacts in a portfolio

items.label: LC109-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to be able to evaluate student work using a rubric that is closely associated with a specific task.

items.label: LC161-D
items.sakai-capability: Resources need to be more engaging

items.label: LC109-E
items.sakai-capability: Ability for student to see rubric at point work is assigned as well as with instructor-assigned points and comments after work is graded. Points assigned in rubric are present in gradebook.

items.sakai-capability: I want to lable resources so that someone can see at a glance what they are

items.label: LC095-F
items.sakai-capability: Users should be able to export their data along with aspects of the workflow in which they produced it. Exports should have the capability to stand alone. Exports should also allow historical snapshots to see change over time.

items.label: LC111-C
items.sakai-capability: I want to create an instructional sequence through which students can move fluidly (i.e., without having to jump to different tools or locations). I want to be able to rearrange, add to, or remove items from the sequence at any point in time. I want a record of what students have completed at any given point in time.

items.label: LC101-F
items.sakai-capability: "Just-in-Time Teaching (JITT for short) is a teaching and learning strategy based on the interaction between web-based study assignments and an active learner classroom. Students respond electronically to carefully constructed web-based assignments which are due shortly before class, and the instructor reads the student submissions "just-in-time" to adjust the classroom lesson to suit the students' needs. Thus, the heart of JiTT is the "feedback loop" formed by the students' outside-of-class preparation that fundamentally affects what happens during the subsequent in-class time together."

items.label: LC101-G
items.sakai-capability: instructor needs to post activity.assignment; students need to post a response that is hidden to other students; instructor needs to be able to view and save  all responses quickly.

items.label: LC111-E
